name: ChemistrySizeDistribution
description: Entity for alloy composition and particle size distribution.  Example: an alloy with two types of precipitate, one with a size distribution discretised into 200 size classes and the other discretised into 500 size classes will have 700 domains.

dimensions.name: ndomains
dimensions.description: Number of geometrical (size) domains.  The matrix is not counted as a domain.

properties.name: elements
properties.description: Chemical symbol of each chemical element.  By convension the dependent element (e.g. Al) is listed first.

properties.name: phases
properties.description: Name of each phase.  First phase is matrix.

properties.name: X0
properties.description: Nominal composition.  Should sum to one.

properties.name: Xd
properties.description: Average composition of each domain.  Each row should sum to one.

properties.name: rd
properties.description: Equivalent spherical radius (radius of a sphere with the same volume as the particle) for each domain.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: Shape parameter for each domain.  It is defined as ``6*sqrt(pi)*V/S^(3/2)``, where V and S are the particle volume and surface area, respectively.  The shape parameter will always be equal to or less than one, where one corresponds to spherical particles.

properties.name: Nd
properties.description: Particle number density of each domain.

properties.name: phasenames
properties.description: Name of the phase that this domain is associated to.

properties.name: atvol
properties.description: Average volume per atom for each domain.
